etymologies: late 17th century; earliest use found in William Petyt (?1641–1707), lawyer and political propagandist. Back-formation from scrivener

definitions: To write or work as a scrivener; to write with care and attention.
Of a scrivener: to draw up or copy out (a document or text). Hence more generally: to write (a letter, report, novel, etc.); to put (something) in writing.
